article.headline: Belmont 67, Central Florida 52
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Will Peeples scored 13 points and Belmont overcame an 11-point first-half deficit to beat Central Florida 67-52 on Sunday. A dunk by Joshua Peppers, who finished with 16 points, gave the Golden Knights (12-6, 5-5 Atlantic Sun Conference) a 20-9 lead with 5:02 left in the first half. Belmont (7-10, 6-3) shot just 5-for-20 in the first half and trailed 27-22 at the half. But the Bruins went on a 9-2 run to take a 47-41 lead on Dan Oliver's 3-pointer with 6:20 left. UCF cut the deficit to 49-47 on two free throws by Gary Johnson with 4:47 remaining. But Belmont finished the game on an 18-5 run, including hitting 9-of-10 from the free-throw line the final 3:30, to win its fourth consecutive conference game at home. Jese Snyder scored 12 points and Brian Collins added 10 for the Bruins.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
